Package gui

Class ChooseReportTypeController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.AbstractController
      • gui.ChooseReportTypeController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SceneSetter
    public class ChooseReportTypeController
extends AbstractController
    Controller class for the Choose Report Type screen. Allows the user to select a report type and choose a specific lecturer, student, or course for generating a report. The selected report type and chosen user or course are passed to the next screen. Author: Mor Shmuel

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class gui.AbstractController

        courseController, msgReceived, notification, prevScreen, questionController, requestController, studentTestController, subjectController, testController, testToExecuteController, userController

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChooseReportTypeController

        public ChooseReportTypeController()
        Default constructor for the ChooseReportTypeController class. Initializes the data for comboBox that fits to each radio button(lecturer,student and course).

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        protected void initialize()
        Initializes the controller after its root element has been completely processed. This method is called when loading the FXML file.

      • onCourseSelected

        void onCourseSelected​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Event handler for the course radio button. Populates the combo box with course names and sets the selected course.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • onLecturerSelected

        void onLecturerSelected​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Event handler for the lecturer radio button. Populates the combo box with lecturer names and sets the selected lecturer.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • onStudentSelected

        void onStudentSelected​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Event handler for the student radio button. Populates the combo box with student names and sets the selected student.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.

      • showReport

        void showReport​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Event handler for the "Show" button. Sets the selected user or course based on the chosen report type and navigates to the "lecturerStaticsReport" screen.
        Parameters:
        event - The action event.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if an error occurs during navigation to the next screen.
